history.content:
Do you have advising questions?  Our advisors are here to help!  EECS students may see Nicole, Andrea, and Lydia in 205 Cory for assistance or schedule an appointment through berkeleyeecs.youcanbook.me.  L&S CS students may see Emerald, Lily, and Charlene in Soda Hall, and Nicole, Andrea, and Lydia in 205 Cory or schedule an appointment through Cal Central.  The L&S Computer Science staff in Soda Hall also hosts drop-in hours for quick questions on Wednesdays, 10am-12pm and 1-4pm.

Our peer advisers are back!

Steven Tan: M/W 2pm-4pm

Michelle Hsueh: M/W 10am-12pm

Vish Ramamurthy: T/TH 11am-12:30pm

You can find them in front of HP Auditorium, Soda Hall or reach them at cs-peers@cs.berkeley.edu.

They'll also take over answering questions posted here.

Undergraduate Volunteers Needed for "Expanding Your Horizons Conference"

We need YOU at Expanding Your Horizons!

 

EYH is a conference for 5th-8th grade girls that serves to introduce them to careers in STEAM through an array of fun interactive workshops.

 

When: Saturday, March 17th from 7:00 AM - 4:30 PM

Where: University of California, Berkeley

 

This year we will be hosting ~450 conference attendees from surrounding East Bay communities.  As an undergraduate mentor, you will assist workshop leaders, join the girls for lunch, share your STEAM experience, and act as a positive role model throughout the day. We do ask that our undergraduate mentors identify as womxn or non-binary. All are welcome to serve as general volunteers.

 

In addition to conference day participation, volunteers are REQUIRED to attend a training session.

 

SIGN-UP to volunteer and/or get more information at ocf.berkeley.edu/~eyh/

Questions? E-mail us at eyh.ucb.volunteer@gmail.com

Machine Learning @ Berkeley

Machine Learning @ Berkeley (ML@B) is excited to announce an extensive workshop series covering a wide range of topics in Deep Learning! Every week, we'll be covering topics from ML Libraries, to Deep Learning basics, to more specialized topics. Below is a copy of the workshop schedule (also available at https://ml.berkeley.edu/workshops).

Design Interns at Berkeley's SkyDeck

Calling all designers! Interested in startups and cutting-edge technology? Join us at SkyDeck Design, the inaugural design team for Berkeley’s very own startup accelerator. This is an opportunity to do hands-on design work with some of the most innovative startups, gain valuable experience, add to your portfolio, and expand your network! Design projects range from UI/UX and product design to visual and graphic design. There are currently 16 startups in the program, including Kiwi Campus, Berkeley’s food delivery robot.

 

Please fill out this form to indicate your interest and we will get back to you shortly: http://bit.ly/skydeckdesign

Co-op Internships at Boehringer Ingelheim

Looking for a long internship?

 

A co-op internship involves taking one semester off school to work for a company for six months, spring-summer or summer-fall. Provided that you are in good academic standing and discuss your plans with your faculty and staff academic advisors, returning to your studies after the internship is not a problem and an additional semester is granted to complete your degree. Co-ops can be extremely rewarding experiences where students build a deep set of skills.

 

If interested in one of the positions attached at Boehringer Ingelheim, apply directly to the company. Before accepting a job do not forget to check with your advisers to ensure that you will be able to graduate on schedule. The department does not manage your co-op internship but is available to guide you through the withdrawal and readmission.

 

Students can bring their resumes to Bio-Tech Connect on 2/22 or resumes can be sent to Nichole Simmons, Recruitment Specialist, at nichole.simmons.ext@boehringer-ingelheim.com. All interested students should add on the subject line “Boehringer Ingelheim Co-Op Application.” Their cover letters must state which one of the Co-Ops they are interested in.

 

Five positions attached: project management, data analytics, systems implementation, validation, and automation.

Engineering For Kids - Volunteer Opportunity on March 17th

Engineering for Kids (E4K) Day hosts hundreds of 4-6th students for a free one-day science and engineering education event where kids can participate in fun, hands-on engineering activities. We are looking for volunteers to help with our event on Saturday, March 17th. Sign-up to volunteer at e4k.berkeley.edu/volunteer. Please visit our website or contact volunteer@e4k.berkeley.edu for more information.

Call for Undergraduate Applications for SMART 2018

UC Berkeley undergraduates are invited to apply for the 2018 Student Mentoring & Research Teams (SMART) Program.

 

The application deadline is Friday, February 23, 2018, 11:59 p.m. (PST).

SMART is a summer program designed to encourage graduate student professional development and to foster undergraduate research through mentoring. Approximately 24 undergraduate mentees will be selected; each mentee will work with a graduate student research mentor in summer 2018 and receive a $3,500 stipend.

 

If you are interested in applying to the 2018 SMART Program, please visit our website at http://smart.berkeley.edu/. The undergraduate application, a description of the projects for the 2018 SMART Program, eligibility criteria for undergraduates, and other information about the program can be accessed at http://smart.berkeley.edu/undergraduate/.

 

Undergraduates interested in the 2018 SMART Program are encouraged to attend an informational meeting on Wednesday, February 14, 2018, from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m., 309 Sproul Hall.

 

Questions about the SMART Program should be directed to Sarah Macdonald, NSF-SMART Postdoctoral Fellow at smartmentoring@berkeley.edu.

STEM mentors needed in Berkeley middle schools - final session!

The BAS (Be A Scientist) program is in need for STEM volunteer mentors right now for Spring 2018! We are excited to continue our program in all three middle schools in Berkeley, finishing with Session 4 at Longfellow Middle School. We have a special need for Spanish-fluent mentors in two dual-immersion lab periods and mentors to volunteer in the afternoons on Tuesdays!

 

Be A Scientist: Inspire 7th graders to discover their inner scientist! www.crscience.org/volunteers/BeAScientist

We invite UC Berkeley graduate students, post-docs, and motivated 3rd/4th year undergrads to take part in Be A Scientist, an exciting science outreach program in Berkeley middle schools!

 

The upcoming semester is as follows:

  • Session 4 Spring 2018 will take place at Longfellow Middle School, February 27th - April 17th, with a two week gap (March 27/April 3) for both UCB and BUSD Spring Breaks

 

As a volunteer scientist mentor, you will guide 7th graders through the process of designing and conducting their own scientific investigations in class over a 6-week period. This is a wonderful opportunity for you to serve as a STEM role model while developing your communication skills and gaining hands-on experience in important science outreach.

Details:

  • Mentors must commit to one mandatory 2-hr Training Session: On-campus trainings are offered in the weeks before the start of each session. Training dates/times/locations TBA

  • Commit to attend one school lab period each week for the 6-week program (schedule program dates here).

  • Guide 4-6 student mentees through the process of developing a testable question, designing an appropriate experiment, and gathering and analyzing data. Each student in your group will have the opportunity to choose an independent scientific question based on their own interests.

 

Please carefully read over the details provided in the attached flyer and on our website. Sign up as a mentor to make an impact on future scientists, engineers, and critical thinkers!

Boeing Day Spring 2018 Application

Interested in the Aerospace Industry? Want a chance to take a VIP tour of the Boeing factory where some of the largest aircrafts are built? If so, apply to take part in this year’s “Boeing Day” at the Everett, Washington site on March 30th, 2018 (during Spring Break).

The day will consist of tours, lunch with their senior leadership, and guest speakers from across the company. You’ll get the chance to see what it’s like to be an engineer at Boeing and all the different opportunities available through the company.

Transportation (from UC Berkeley to Washington and back) and lodging will be covered by UC Berkeley SWE! Don’t miss out on this amazing opportunity!

 

Application link: https://tinyurl.com/boeing-day-2018

Event dates: March 29th, 2018 to March 30th, 2018

Location: Everett, Washington

Application Deadline: February 23rd, 2018 at 11:59pm

A Panel Discussion Geared for Students

Dear Students,

We cordially invite you to attend our annual How I Became a Quant discussion on February 27. Practitioners at top firms will share their experiences, how to prepare for a career in finance and data science, and trends emerging in the field. Networking and Q&A will follow. If you are interested in a career in finance or data science, don't miss this opportunity!

Date: Tuesday, February 27, 2018

Schedule: 4:30 PM Registration

5:00 PM Program Begins: Panel Discussion and Q&A

6:15 PM Reception and Networking (light refreshments served)

Location: Spieker Forum (N640), Chou Hall, Haas School of Business

The event is open to the public, so please share this invitation widely.

We look forward to seeing you at Haas for How I Became a Quant 2018! Please RSVP here.

Thank you!

The Berkeley MFE Admissions Team

mfe.berkeley.edu

Statistical Modeling and Machine Learning uLab Openings

The Undergraduate Lab @ Berkeley (ULAB) is looking for machine learning staff scientists, project leaders, and mentors willing to lead small groups of students on various projects involving data science, computer vision, and natural language processing. For this semester we have 3 main projects planned:

  • Automating the identification of atomic nuclei in medical imaging datasets, helping researchers to understand cellular processes and shortening the time it takes to develop new drugs

  • Utilizing the deep learning stack to mimic the artistic style of a painting and transfer it to another image

  • Determining the helpfulness of Amazon reviews using deep learning models for NLP to perform sentiment analysis of the text data

If you want to get involved with a cutting-edge ML research project, as well as obtain valuable leadership experience collaborating with others, you can read more about the positions and apply here: https://ulab.berkeley.edu/lab-jobs/ml. Course credit is also available. You can also learn about other computational roles within ULAB here: https://ulab.berkeley.edu/software-jobs.

Shadow an Engineer Spring 2018

Date/Time: Student application due March 4th, 2018 at 4PM

Location: Participating companies

Description:

Curious what it's like to be an engineer in industry? Apply for Shadow an Engineer Program hosted by Society of Women Engineers!

 

Through this program, you will have the opportunity to get real-life exposure at some of the most innovative companies in the area! This program will occur for 1 to 3 days over winter break and is an awesome chance to network with the company you might want to work for in the future. The application will close on Sunday, March 4th, 2018 at 4PM. Apply early!

 

Apply here: http://tinyurl.com/sae-sp18-student

Participating company descriptions: http://tinyurl.com/sae-sp18-company

Facebook event link: https://www.facebook.com/events/188000075140098/

 

*All genders are encouraged to apply

*You will be responsible for your own transportation to the company location, we do not provide travel reimbursement

Engineering Student Services is pleased to present the Spring Undergraduate Research Symposium Poster Session

Date: Monday, April 30th

Time: 12 to 2 pm

Location:  Hearst Memorial Mining Building Lobby  

 

Undergraduate students (ranging from freshmen to seniors) will be presenting their research on a wide range of projects across the College of Engineering.

 

How to Participate:

The poster session is open to all College of Engineering undergraduate students working with Engineering Faculty!

 

Link to Submit

https://tinyurl.com/ya5g4h3g

The deadline to submit Abstracts is April 15th

Statistical Modeling and Machine Learning uLab Openings

The Undergraduate Lab @ Berkeley (ULAB) is looking for machine learning staff scientists, project leaders, and mentors willing to lead small groups of students on various projects involving data science, computer vision, and natural language processing. For this semester we have 3 main projects planned:

  • Automating the identification of atomic nuclei in medical imaging datasets, helping researchers to understand cellular processes and shortening the time it takes to develop new drugs

  • Utilizing the deep learning stack to mimic the artistic style of a painting and transfer it to another image

  • Determining the helpfulness of Amazon reviews using deep learning models for NLP to perform sentiment analysis of the text data

If you want to get involved with a cutting-edge ML research project, as well as obtain valuable leadership experience collaborating with others, you can read more about the positions and apply here: https://ulab.berkeley.edu/lab-jobs/ml. Course credit is also available. You can also learn about other computational roles within ULAB here: https://ulab.berkeley.edu/software-jobs.
